Sentence.sentence: search of food, they make the waste sites their winter feeding grounds.

Writing in the journal, the scientists describe how the storks from Germany were clearly affected by the presence of waste sites, with four out of six birds that survived for at least five months overwintering on rubbish dumps in northern Morocco, instead of migrating to the Sahel.
Researchers in Germany used miniature GPS tags to track the migrations of 70 white storks ( ' , 鹳) from different sites across Europe and Asia during the first five months of their lives.
Landfill sites on the Iberian Peninsula have long attracted local white storks, but all of the Spanish birds tagged in the study flew across the Sahara Desert to the western Sahel.
Instead of flying thousands of miles in search of food, they make the waste sites their winter feeding grounds.
According to Richard Rusczyk, the company founder, the six U.S.team members who competed at the IMO last year collectively took more than 40 courses on the site.

At least three Russian stations are already operating in Antarctica, part of its effort to challenge the dominance of the American GPS, and new stations are planned for sites like the Russian base, in the shadow of the Orthodox Church of the Holy Trinity.
When they returned home, their droppings end up all around their nesting sites, including in nearby ponds.
Inefficient harvesting, inadequate local transportation and poor infrastructure (基础设施)mean that produce is frequently handled inappropriately and stored under unsuitable farm site conditions.

These included developing additional domestic sources (such as those on Alaska's North Slope), resuming extraction at sites that had been shut down because of cost inefficiency, capping the price that domestic producers could charge for oil, and beginning to import oil from a greater diversity of nations.
During January, Hartwick runs a four week course during which students may earn three to four credits on or off campus, including a number of international sites.

Drop in bias Brian Nosek of the University of Virginia in Charlottesville, who runs a website that measures implicit bias using similar test, has also observed a small drop in bias in the 700,000 visitors to the site since January 2007, which might be explained by Obama's rise to popularity

Moreover they site several advantages: alleviation of school overcrowding, strengthen family relationships, lower dropout rates, the facts that students are allowed to learn at their own rate, increased motivation, higher standardized test scores, and reduced discipline problems.
Receptionist in an attorney's office and a welder at a construction site.
Researchers at Cambridge University have found that nearly half of the social networking sites don't immediately delete pictures when a user requests they be removed.
For example, there is the image of the bridge into the sea taken at the Normandy D-Day landing site.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"地点，位置，场所"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: place, position, spot, situation, site, location, locality, setting, scene
means: place ： 含义广泛，最普通用词，既可指很小的地点，又可指很大很远的地方或场所。
position ： 多指物体相对于其他物体所处的位置或状态。
spot ： 指相对较小的特定地点或事物所在地。
situation ： 指物体在其周围环境中所处的位置或状态，侧重地点或场所的环境特征。
site ： 指或大或小的地方，既可指供专门用途或特定活动的地点，又可指某一事件的地址。
location ： 指某物设置的方向或地点。
locality ： 指某物所处的客观位置和周围地区。
setting ： 一般特指戏剧或小说所写的环境或场所。
scene ： 常指真实事件或虚构故事发生的地点。

word_mean: 位点，基因组内具有一定功能（如突变、重组及与其他分子相互作用等）的一个或若干个核苷酸突变的位置

Sentence.sentence: Toyota Motor, for example, alleviated some of the damage from its recall crisis earlier this year with a relatively quick and well-orchestrated social-media response campaign, which included efforts to engage with consumers directly on sites such as Twitter and the social-news site Digg.
Consumers passionate about a product may create “owned” media by sending e-mail alerts about products and sales to customers registered with its Web site.
But in some cases, one marketer’s owned media become another marketer’s paid media – for instance, when an e-commerce retailer sells ad space on its Web site.

Besides generating income, the presence of other marketers makes the site seem objective, gives companies opportunities to learn valuable information about the appeal of other companies’ marketing, and may help expand user traffic for all companies concerned.
The networked computer is an amazing device, the first media machine that serves as the mode of production, means of distribution, site of reception, and place of praise and critique.
Two- and three-dimensional maps are helpful tools in planning excavations, illustrating how sites look, and presenting the results of archaeological research.
To find their sites, archaeologists today rely heavily on systematic survey methods and a variety of high-technology tools and techniques.
Surveys and test samples have also become important for understanding the larger landscapes that contain archaeological sites.
Some archaeological sites have always been easily observable-for example, the Parthenon in Athens, Greece; the pyramids of Giza in Egypt; and the megaliths of Stonehenge in southern England.
Olduvai Gorge, an early hominid site in Tanzania, was found by a butterfly hunter who literally fell into its deep valley in 1911.
Most archaeological sites, however, are discovered by archaeologists who have set out to look for them.
Most archaeological sites have been located by means of careful searching, while many others have been discovered by accident.
But these sites are exceptions to the norm.
British archaeologist Howard Carter knew that the tomb of the Egyptian pharaoh Tutankhamun existed from information found in other sites.
Archaeologists commonly use computers to map sites and the landscapes around sites.
The London agents Stirling Ackroyd recently identified enough sites for half a million houses in the London area alone，with no intrusion on green belt.
He favours out-of-town shopping sites against high streets.
To limit the number of telescopes on Mauna Kea, old ones will be removed at the end of their lifetimes and their sites returned to a natural state.
The TMT site was chosen to minimize the telescope’s visibility around the island and to avoid archaeological and environmental impact.
In December of 1869, Congress appointed a commission to select a site and prepare plans and cost estimates for a new State Department Building.
Amazon.com, with its network of warehouses, also collects sales tax in every state that charges it, though third-party sellers who use the site don't have to.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

mean.mean: （建筑物、城镇等的）地点，位置，建筑工地

entry.def: A site is a piece of ground that is used for a particular purpose or where a particular thing happens.

example.ex: He became a hod carrier on a building site.
example.tran: 他在建筑工地上当起了小工。

example.ex: ...a bat sanctuary with special nesting sites...
example.tran: 专门辟出了筑巢处的蝙蝠禁猎区

entry.def: The site of an important event is the place where it happened.

example.ex: Scientists have described the Aral sea as the site of the worst ecological disaster on earth...
example.tran: 科学家把咸海描述成地球上最严重的生态灾难发生地。

example.ex: Plymouth Hoe is renowned as the site where Drake played bowls before tackling the Spanish Armada.
example.tran: 普利茅斯高地是德雷克在打败西班牙无敌舰队之前玩木球游戏的旧址，因此广为人知。

entry.def: A site is a piece of ground where something such as a statue or building stands or used to stand.
entry.tran: (建造房屋等的)地皮，地基，遗址

example.ex: ...the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem, which is regarded by some as Christianity's holiest site.
example.tran: 耶路撒冷圣墓教堂——一些人眼中基督教最神圣的地方

entry.def: A site is the same as a website .
If something is sited in a particular place or position, it is put there or built there.

example.ex: He said chemical weapons had never been sited in Germany.
example.tran: 他声称从未在德国部署过化学武器。

example.ex: ...a damp, old castle, romantically sited on a river estuary.
example.tran: 坐落在河湾之上的一座阴冷潮湿的古城堡，仿佛传奇中描述的一般

entry.def: If someone or something is on site, they are in a particular area or group of buildings where people work, study, or stay.

example.ex: It is cheaper to have extra building work done when the builder is on site.
example.tran: 建筑工在现场干活时，让他额外做工的话工钱会便宜一些。

entry.def: If someone or something is off site, they are away from a particular area or group of buildings where people work, study, or stay.

example.ex: There is ample car parking off site.
example.tran: 外面有很多地方可以停车。

means.word_mean: 1. the piece of land on which something is located (or is to be located);
2. physical position in relation to the surroundings;

sentences.sentence: "the sites are determined by highly specific sequences of nucleotides"

means.word_mean: 3. a computer connected to the internet that maintains a series of web pages on the World Wide Web;

sentences.sentence: "the Israeli web site was damaged by hostile hackers"
"The company located some of their agents in Los Angeles"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a noun): from Anglo-norman French, or from Latin situs 'local position'. The verb dates from the late 16th cent
